library.description: store.js exposes a simple API for cross browser local storage
library.name: store.js

library.description: A simple, lightweight jQuery plugin for reading, writing and deleting cookies.
library.name: jquery.cookie

library.description: sql.js is a port of SQLite to JavaScript, by compiling the SQLite C code with Emscripten.
library.name: sql.js

library.description: a lawnchair is sorta like a couch except smaller and outside. perfect for html5 mobile apps that need a lightweight, adaptive, simple and elegant persistence solution.
library.name: lawnchair

library.description: TaffyDB wraps localStorage and provides comprehensive query related functionality.
library.name: TaffyDB

library.description: Cookies.js is a small client-side javascript library that makes managing cookies easy. Compatible with all major browsers (and not so major browsers, like IE 6), the minified library weighs in at less than 1 KB when gzipped. Cookies.js also supports AMD and CommonJS loaders.
library.name: Cookies.js

library.description: JavaScript client library for the Dropbox API, written in CoffeeScript, suitable for use in both modern browsers and in server-side code running under node.js.
library.name: dropbox-js

library.description: Btapp.js provides a Backbone based library that interfaces with underlying BitTorrent products, such as BitTorrent, uTorrent, or the gui-less Torque product. Allows for easy torrent downloading via your web app.
library.name: Btapp.js

library.description: basket.js is a small JavaScript library supporting localStorage caching of scripts. If script(s) have previously been saved locally, they will simply be loaded and injected into the current document. If not, they will be XHR'd in for use right away, but cached so that no additional loads are required in the future.
library.name: basket.js

library.description: A redis-like wrapper for javascript data storage using localStorage as the default persistent data-store.
library.name: BankersBox

library.description: cookie.js is a tiny JavaScript library that simplifies cookies. It is capable of setting, getting and removing cookies, accepts a variety of parameters, and supports chaining. cookie.js is released under the MIT/X11 license. It doesn't have any dependencies and minified and gzipped it's only 0.9 KB small.
library.name: cookie.js

library.description: A cross-browser wrapper for IndexedDB
library.name: IDBWrapper

library.description: Standard based crossplatform JavaScript library and set of practices to access and manipulate data from various online and offline sources.
library.name: JayData

library.description: loStorage.js uses the HTML5 localStorage and sessionStorage APIs to provide a persistant client-side storage, mainly targeted at web apps. It has a cookie.js like interface.
library.name: loStorage.js

library.description: Kizzy is a light-weight, cross-browser, JavaScript local storage utility. It leverages the HTML5 localStorage API when available, as well as Internet Explorer's persistent XML store â€” wrapped up in a easy to use, memcached-like interface. When neither of these features are available (unlikely), it falls back to an in-browser object store.
library.name: Kizzy

library.description: Javascript database module for Indexeddb, Web SQL and localStorage storage mechanisms supporting version migration, advanced query, SQL and transaction.
library.name: ydn-db

library.description:
LocalDB.js is a tool that maps the structure of the databases in objects using the localStorage API, no database drivers are required, just add the library and use it!

Useful for web applications, mobile apps or game engines.
library.name: LocalDB.js (NoSQL)

library.description: PouchDB is a JavaScript library that allows you to store and query data for web applications that need to work offline, and sync with an online database when you are online.
library.name: PouchDB

library.description: Artemia is a clientside JSON document store like Lawnchair (in the way of CouchDb).
library.name: artemia

library.description: The JavaScript library for using 'localStorage' & 'sessionStorage' more easy.
library.name: Rockstage.js

library.description: Simple localStorage / sessionStorage supporting objects and arrays
library.name: simple-storage

library.description: An abstracted storage engine supporting both html5 localstorage and cookies.
library.name: storage.js

library.description: story.js enables web developers to use client-side storages in a simple and consistent way. It includes abstraction layer on top of Web Storage API, IndexedDB API, Cookies API and In-Memory storage.
library.name: story.js

library.description: meelo-store is a javascript library that makes it easy to work with client-side data. It borrows concepts and syntax from jQuery and Django.
library.name: meelo-store

library.description: light json data storage that allows indexing of data for faster retrieval and saving to localstorage
library.name: JSDB

library.description: A basic browser based database implementation via localStorage and JSON
library.name: lsd.js

library.description: Pocket is a high performance storage library. It provides an API which resembles MongoDB's proven syntax and provides a powerful lightweight abstraction from the complexity of storage. Pocket support multiple methods of storage including localStorage, Web SQL, Cordova SQLite plugin and IndexedDB.
library.name: PocketJS

library.description:
localForage is a handy library that improves the offline experience of your web app by using asynchronous storage (via IndexedDB or WebSQL where available) but with a simple, localStorage-like API.

localForage includes a localStorage-backed fallback store for browsers with no IndexedDB or WebSQL support. This means that asynchronous storage is available in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari (including Safari Mobile).
library.name: localForage

library.description: tds is an implementation of the TDS protocol, which is used for communication with Microsoft's SQL Server.
library.name: tds

library.description: Simple localStorage, sessionStorage and cookie operating library with the single API.
library.name: strg.js

library.description: Rhaboo makes JS objects persistent, including deeply nested ones. The programmer uses these objects just like normal ones (almost.) It's fast because it doesn't use stringify/parse. It's portable because it only relies on localStorage, things like IndexedDB and WebSQL having no advantage when localStorage is used efficiently.
library.name: Rhaboo

library.description: A Minimalistic Wrapper for IndexedDB with Promise/A+ compliant transaction support.
library.name: Dexie.js

library.description: Crudlet is a universal interface for communicating with data sources whether it's your API, mongodb, pubnub, webrtc, socket.io, redis, or local storage. Easily build sophisticated features such as offline-mode, realtime data, rollbacks, and more with little effort.
library.name: Crudlet.js

library.description: In-memory Javascript Datastore with Persistence
library.name: LokiJS

library.description: These days, your app need to store and sync more than just files. With the Datastore API, structured data like contacts, to-do items, and game state can be synced effortlessly. Datastores work across platforms, offline, and even support automatic conflict resolution.
library.name: Dropbox Datastore
